title: Natural gas production - United States 1998 to 2018
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Production in billion cubic meters, with a total of 20 data points. The chart has 6 significant trends.
The longest trend is moderately positive which exists from 2016 to 2007.
Likewise, the next significant trend is extremely positive which exists from 2018 to 2016.
Likewise, the next significant trend is moderately positive which exists from 2007 to 2005.
Similarly, the next significant trend is slightly negative which exists from 2005 to 2003.
Contrarily, the next significant trend is slightly negative which exists from 2003 to 2001.
Differently, the next significant trend is moderately positive which exists from 2001 to 1998.
gold: Production of natural gas in the United States has been increasing for the past decade and amounted to 831.8 billion cubic meters in 2018 . An increase in production corresponded with rising demand for natural gas in the United States , particularly after the 2008 Recession . Natural gas becomes competitive Since the early 2000s , the price of coal had been going up , and increased more rapidly following the 2008 Recession , which affected the cost of crude oil to an even greater degree .
